data.title: Colorado Association of Science Teachers
data.text:
CAST Awards For Excellence in Science Teaching

CAST and the American Vacuum Society offer awards for Excellence in Science Teaching in the state of Colorado. The awards are presented each year at the Colorado Science Conference, in November, in the amount of $500 each. A CAST Award is selected at each of three levels: Elementary, Secondary, and College/Informal. To be eligible for the CAST award you must be a CAST member in good standing. For the Elementary, Middle School, and High School awards, you also must be currently teaching science in a Colorado school. Nominees for the College/Informal award consist of college instructors of science and informal educators of science.

Deadline for submission is May 7, 2024. To nominate yourself or another individual, please click on the link below or submit the application as indicated on the file below.

CAST Excellence in Science Teaching Online Application

CAST Excellence in Science Teaching Application to Download

American Vacuum Society Award for Excellence in Science Teaching

The American Vacuum Society also sponsors an award for Excellence in Science Teaching in the state of Colorado. The award is presented each year at the Colorado Science Conference, in November, in the amount of $500. An AVS Award is selected at each of three levels: Elementary, Secondary, and College/Informal. You do not need to be a CAST member to receive the AVS award. To be eligible, you must be currently teaching science in a Colorado school.

The Rocky Mountain Chapter of the American Vacuum Society (RMCAVS) has a website at https://www.rmcavs.org/

Deadline for submission is by May 7th.

To nominate yourself or another individual, please click on the link below or submit the application as indicated on the file below.

AVS Excellence in Science Teaching Online Application
